alert.note: Alert for Hamilton; Northern Warren (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 26 at 9:48AM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A cluster of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Hamilton and northwestern Warren Counties through 1015 AM EDT... At 947 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms near Lewey Lake Campground, or near Speculator, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Speculator, Johnsburg, Lewey Lake Campground, North Creek, Byrnes Corners, Sodom, Riparius, Edwards Hill, Christian Hill, Wevertown, Holcombville, North River, Igerna and Bakers Mills. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes.
